greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(0)=1 and for n>0, a(n) = (1-a(floor(log2(n)))) * a(n-msb(n)); Characteristic function of A079599.
comment: This is NOT the leftmost column of A125999, as here a(2^64) = 0, while X_A126002(2^64) = 1.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8192
formula: a(0) = 1 and for n > 0, a(n) = (1-a(A000523(n))) * a(A053645(n)). [Where A000523 gives the bit-index of the most significant bit of n (msb), and A053645 gives n without its msb]
For all n, a(n) * A034798(n) = 0 (as ones in this sequence occur at the positions where zeros are in A034798).
a(n) = A000529(n-3)(mod 2), for n>3. - _John M. Campbell_, Jul 15 2016
program: (Scheme, with _Antti Karttunen_'s IntSeq-library for memoizing definec-macro, two alternative implementations)
(definec (A236677 n) (let loop ((n n) (i 0)) (cond ((zero? n) 1) ((odd? n) (if (= 1 (A236677 i)) 0 (loop (/ (- n 1) 2) (+ i 1)))) (else (loop (/ n 2) (+ i 1))))))
xref: A236678 gives the partial sums. Differs from the characteristic function of A047467 for the first at n=256, as here a(256)=0, while X_A047467(256)=1 because 256 = 0 modulo 8.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 29 2014
